roleset.name: help, ease, get rid of, make feel better

role.descr: thing being helped, eased, gotten rid of

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: Ports in the Great Lakes and Atlantic Coast can also relievepressure on New Orleans.
example.arg: Ports in the Great Lakes and Atlantic Coast

example.name: benefactive: relieve of
example.text: Mr. Wall relieved them of responsibility for supervising Lincolnin 1988.

example.name: Example with args 1 and 2
example.text: Senate and House bills to provide special casualty-loss treatmentand other tax relief for timber growers in the hurricane disasterareas
example.arg: for timber growers in the hurricane disasterareas

example.name: Slightly different arg 1
example.text: this and other deadline relief for Hugo 's victims

example.name: When you may be tempted to use an arg 0
example.text: They provide relief for poor farmers

roleset.note: RELIEVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'relieve' based on sentences in wsj and automaticexpansion via verbnet.In the absence of arg2 the two rolesets might be easy to confusealthough they are semantically quite distinct. (from relieve.01-v predicate notes)
RELIEF-N NOTES: Roleset based on relieve.01. Corresponds to Verbnet class cheat-10.6, free-80-1 and amuse-31.1. Updated by Julia (from relief.01-n)
RELIEVING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from relieving.01-j)

roleset.name: make feel better

example.name: prepositional arg0
example.text: With investors relieved at the overnight gain in New York stocks,small-lot buying orders streamed into the market from early morning,making traders believe the market was back to normal.
example.arg: at the overnight gain in New York

example.name: more normal arg0
example.text: And [some commuters]-1, relieved *trace*-1 by the absence of gridlock,were planning to return to their old ways.

example.name: sentential arg0
example.text: Around Wall Street, [trading desks]-1 were relieved *trace*-1 that theycould at least play the market yesterday, in contrast to Friday'sgridlock.
example.arg: that theycould at least play the market yesterday, in contrast to Friday'sgridlock.

roleset.note: RELIEVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'relieve' based on sentences in wsj and automaticexpansion via verbnet.In the absence of arg2 the two rolesets might be easy to confusealthough they are semantically quite distinct. (from relieve.02-v predicate notes)
RELIEVED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from relieved.02-j)
